content:
Voice Call Recordings

To be trained, ensure compliance, and collaborate on customer issues, agents and others can listen to and comment on call recordings. Ensure the right users can listen to, pause, and resume the call recordings.

This feature is available with these telephony models:
SERVICE CLOUD VOICE WITH AMAZON CONNECT
SERVICE CLOUD VOICE WITH PARTNER TELEPHONY FROM AMAZON CONNECT
SERVICE CLOUD VOICE WITH PARTNER TELEPHONY

Requirements to Access Voice Call Recordings
By default, only the voice call owner can listen to a call recording. Depending on your business needs, you can grant access to other users as well.

To grant the right users access to the voice call recordings, review these requirements for each user type:
USER TYPE PERMISSION SET VOICECALL OBJECT ACCESS UNIVERSAL CALL RECORDING ACCESS RECORDING ACCESS
VoiceCall record owner Contact Center Agent Owner 
Contact center user Contact Center Agent Public or shared with user For Amazon Connect: Agent security profile
Non-contact-center user  Owner, Public, or shared with user Enabled 

To learn about each requirement, review this table:
REQUIREMENT DESCRIPTION
Salesforce Permission Set All Salesforce contact center users must be assigned the Contact Center Agent permission set. See Assign Contact Center Permission Sets.
VoiceCall Object Access Regardless of the user type, the user must have access to the VoiceCall object. By default, the VoiceCall record owner has access. To grant others access to the VoiceCall records, set the organization-wide default for the VoiceCall object to Public or use sharing settings. See Organization-Wide Default Access Settings.
Universal Call Recording Access If the user isn’t a member of the contact center, enable Universal Call Recording Access. For an Amazon Connect contact center, see Turn on Universal Call Recording Access. For a partner telephony contact center, see Universal Call Recording Playback.

Turn on Universal Call Recording Access
Turn on Universal Call Recording Access to enable Salesforce users who aren't contact center members to access voice call recordings.

Verify Voice Call Recording Access in Amazon Connect
If you have an Amazon Connect contact center, verify that users can access the voice call recordings stored in Amazon Connect. Without this access, they can’t listen to the recordings in Salesforce.

To show call recordings where the agents work, add the Call Recording Player component to the Voice Call Record page. The player shows the list of call recordings.

See Assign a Security Profile to a User
See Create the Voice Call Record Page
title: Managing Voice Call Recordings in Service Cloud
